item.title: Nigeria Air Force Reacts As Aircraft Crashes In Niger State
item.description: The Nigeria Air Force (NAF) has confirmed the crash of an MI-171 Helicopter on a casualty evacuation near Chukuba Village in Shiroro Local Government Area of Niger State. Naija News earlier reported that the aircraft, on Monday, took off from Kaduna en route to Minna, the Niger state capital when the incident occurred at about 1:00 pm. Reacting to the incident in a statement, the Director of Public Relations and Information of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF), Edward Gabkwet, said the aircraft was on a casualty evacuation mission when the crash happened.

Adesina said the Nigerian leader appealed to the team not to relent in their effort to win the Nations Cup during a chat with representatives of the team via video conference.

South Dakota | Famous Birthdays
item.description: The US state of South Dakota is located in the North Central region. The state's name is derived from the Lakota and Dakota Sioux tribes who inhabited the region. The state's largest metropolitan area is that of Sioux Falls. The state's official mammal is the coyote. It was the 40th state to join the Union. Trivia South Dakota has more total shoreline than the state of Florida. The Wounded Knee Massacre took place in the state in 1890.

item.title: NLC Threatens To Embark On Indefinite Strike If Petrol Price Rises Further
item.description: The Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) has threatened to declare a nationwide strike if there is a further hike in the pump price of petrol from the existing N617 naira. Recall that oil marketers had indicated that the cost of Premium Motor Spirit, popularly called petrol, would rise to between N680/litre and N720/litre in the coming weeks should the dollar continue to trade from N910 to N950 at the parallel market.

item.title: Bandits Have Formed Alliance With Boko Haram, ISWAP
item.description: Governor Abubakar Sani Bello of Niger State has revealed that bandit terrorists have now formed alliance with Boko Haram and ISWAP to carry out attacks on communities in the state. The governor who just came back from an official trip to Turkey stated this in Minna, the stage capita, after visiting injured soldiers at the IBB Specialist hospital. According to the governor, bandits had killed two soldiers and injured 12 others in an attack on Kagara town, headquarters of the Rafi Local Government Area of the state.

item.title: NEMA Speaks On Evacuation Of Collapsed Building Occupants
item.description: The Lagos State Government has started evacuating occupants of a three-storey building that collapsed in Ebute Metta on Sunday night. The Zonal Coordinator Southwest, National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA), Ibrahim Farinloye, stated this in an interview with reporters on Monday in Lagos. Farinloye stated officials of the Lagos State Building Collapse Agency (LASBCA) had begun the evacuation of occupants of the distressed building before it finally collapsed on Sunday. The NEMA official said the evacuation was ongoing to save lives and property, adding that the building had shown signs of serious distress, with part falling off.

item.title: April 4 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: Your determination and strong mind will give you many career opportunities to explore, although choosing one may be easier said than done. item.title: EFCC Speaks On Raiding Justice Odili's Abuja Residence
item.description: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) has refuted media reports that its operatives invaded the Abuja home of Supreme Court Judge, Justice Mary Odili. Naija News learnt that some security operatives on Friday afternoon reportedly stormed the Maitama home of the Supreme Court Judge in Abuja. The operatives were said to have gone to the judge’s home to execute a search warrant as part of investigations into her husband, Peter Odili, who is a former Governor of Rivers State.

item.description: The sharp drop in Nigeria's revenue is now affecting the salaries of members of the National Assembly. item.title: El-Rufai Sacks 19 Political Appointees
item.description: The Governor of Kaduna State, Nasir El-Rufai, on Wednesday, relieved nineteen political appointees of their duties. The El-Rufai-led government disclosed that the development is the first phase of political appointees to be sacked. The Kaduna Government has been called out by Nigerians for sacking thousands of civil servants due to his policy. The state government which had defended its policy noted that it would not continue to pay over 80 percent of its allocation from the federation account to civil servants and assured that the political appointees will also be affected in the exercise.

item.title: Wike Summons Emergency Security Meeting Over Insecurity In Abuja
item.description: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Nyesom Wike, has summoned an emergency security meeting over the high level of killings and kidnappings in Abuja. Naija News reports the meeting has in attendance heads of security formations in Abuja as well as Area Council Chairmen. The Minister charged the chairmen to be alive to their duties and arrest the worrying situation. Wike declared that things would be back under control and urged residents of Abuja to avoid panic.

item.title: 'There Was A Clear, Desperate Gang-Up Against Yahaya Bello'
item.description: The just-concluded national convention of the All Progressives Congress (APC) which produced former Governor of Lagos State, Bola Tinubu as the party’s flag-bearer for the 2023 presidential election was allegedly compromised. Governor of Kogi State, Yahaya Bello alleged this through his Presidential Campaign Organisation in a statement released hours after the declaration of Tinubu as the winner of the APC presidential primaries yesterday. Naija News reports that Governor Bello garnered only 47 votes at the end of the APC primary election in Abuja on Wednesday.

item.description: April is the fourth month of Gregorian calendar, but it is also the month when the warmth of Spring can best be felt. item.title: I'll Continue Fighting Corruption No Matter What - Buhari
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Monday, August 17, reiterated his commitment to staying resolved in the fight against corruption, notwithstanding the pressure that might be put on his administration. The presidency made this known addressing the group of Nigeria which staged an anti-corruption protest at the gate of Aso Rock earlier today. According to Vanguard, represented by his media aide Femi Adesina, Buhari vowed to persecute all those involved in public funds embezzlement in compliance with the rule of law.

item.title: Ondo Commissioner Confirms Akeredolu's Death
item.description: Ondo State Commissioner for Finance, Wale Akinterinwa, has confirmed the death of the state governor, Rotimi Akeredolu. Naija News reported that a family source who spoke with SaharaReporters on Wednesday said Governor Akeredolu died in Lagos at the age of 67. It was learned that Akeredolu was managed by State House doctors up to his death because they could not fly him abroad. Confirming the tragic news to P.M.News, Akeredolu’s close ally, Akinterinwa, said the governor’s death was linked with leukaemia.

item.title: Rivers Assembly Charges Fubara With Misconduct Regarding Appointments
item.description: The Rivers State House of Assembly has levelled accusations against Governor Siminalayi Fubara, alleging illegalities in his recent appointments. Speaker Martin Amaewhule made the accusation during Monday’s plenary session at the Assembly Quarters in Port Harcourt, the state capital. The lawmakers held an unscheduled plenary following their last sitting, during which they overrode the governor and enacted four laws. On Monday, the Majority Leader of the House, Major Jack, brought the recent appointments by the governor to the attention of the Speaker.

item.title: DSS Confirms Plot To Stop Tinubu's Swearing In, Reveals Next Line Of Action
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) on Wednesday disclosed that it has identified some key individuals plotting to scuttle the May 29 handover to a new government and force an interim government in Nigeria. According to the DSS in a statement by its spokesperson, Peter Afunanya, the plot by the identified individuals is to set aside the constitution and undermine civil rule, sponsor mass protests as well as plunge the country into an avoidable crisis in order to make way for the planned interim government.

item.title: You Have Taken Nigeria From Top To Bottom
item.description: Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom has accused President Muhammadu Buhari of recking the economy of Nigeria and plunging the country into security woes. Ortom in a statement on Thursday accused the government of President Buhari of inflicting economic hardship on Nigerians. The statement by the Benue State Governor which was issued by his Chief Press Secretary, Nathaniel Ikyur comes as a response to the allegation by the President that the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has failed.

item.title: Akeredolu's Death Will Enhance My Chances Of Becoming Ondo Governor
item.description: The lawmaker representing Ondo South senatorial district, Jimoh Ibrahim, has declared his intention to contest in the governorship election in Ondo State. Ibrahim who noted that he is ready to contest, said the death of a former governor of the state, Rotimi Akeredolu, will enhance his chances of becoming the next governor. The lawmaker, on Thursday, expressed optimism that there would be no imposition of a candidate from the national leadership of the All Progressives Congress and the Presidency.

FG Announces New Deadline For NIN-SIM Linkage
item.description: The federal government on Saturday, announced an extension of the deadline for Nigerians to link their National Identity Numbers (NIN) with the Subscribers Identity Module (SIM) cards. The previous extension granted by the government was due to expire on the 31st of October 2021 but has again been extended. The new extension urged Nigerians to get the linkage done “before the end of the year 2021.” Announcing the linkage, the Minister of Communications and Digital Economy, Isa Pantami said the extension was approved by President Muhammadu Buhari based on appeals made by the Mobile Network Operators and other industry stakeholders.

item.title: Important characteristics of labour as a factor of production

item.title: Mother Teresa - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Born Anjeze Bojaxhiu, she was a Catholic nun who made it her life's work to care for the sick and disadvantaged. item.title: Tinubu Off To Guinea-Bissau For ECOWAS Summit
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu will leave Abuja for Guinea-Bissau on Saturday, July 8, to attend the 63rd Ordinary Session of the Authority of Heads of State and Government of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), taking place in Bissau, the capital of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. According to Presidential spokesman Dele Alake, the summit, scheduled for Sunday, July 9, will address several important regional topics. These include a report from the 50th Ordinary Session of the Mediation and Security Council (MSC) concerning security challenges within member nations; a report from the 90th Ordinary Session of the ECOWAS Council of Ministers about the group’s financial situation and implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA); and a report on the state of political transition in the Republics of Mali, Burkina Faso, and Guinea.

Now, Steve Carell, Diana Silvers, and more return to the newest workplace comedy that asks what happens behind the scenes at the intergalactic branch of the U.

item.title: 6 real treasures thrown away to trash by their headless owners
item.description: Have you ever thrown a thing into a trash can and regretted it afterward? Well, these people turned their treasure into the trash! They managed to dispose of a fortune in one hasty gesture! A bag full of money! One woman did not really trust the banks, so she kept all her life savings in a bag. She got old and started to forget things. In one of the declutter attempts she just threw away the old bag full of money!

item.title: Ado-Doguwa Opens Up On Reason Amaechi Cannot Contend With Tinubu
item.description: Alhassan Ado-Doguwa, the Majority Leader of the House of Representatives has slammed the Minister of Transportation, Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi for showing interest in the upcoming 2023 presidency. Ado-Doguwa stated that Amaechi should not be thinking of running for president when he was yet to handle his successor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State, who is fighting headlong with the APC. The lawmaker shared his thoughts during an interview on Channels Television.

item.title: Atlanta Has a New Home for Season 11
item.description: Here's everything we know about Season 11 of 'Love & Hip Hop: Atlanta.' Along with returning cast members and fresh faces, the show has a new home. By D.M.May 10 2023, Published 8:44 a.m. ET VH1’s popular show, Love & Hip Hop: Atlanta, has been a mainstay on the network since it premiered in 2012. The reality series, a spinoff of the New York-based Love & Hip Hop, spotlights the lives and careers of industry figures in the Atlanta area.

item.title: Connor Corum - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actor best known for his role as Colton Burpo in the religiously-themed 2014 film 'Heaven Is for Real.' He was cast in the role following a nationwide search by the film's producers. Before Fame He had no acting experience prior to his being cast in "Heaven Is for Real." Trivia He sang 'Amazing Grace' at his audition for the role of Colton Burpo. Family Life His father is Chris and his mother is Shannon Corum.

item.title: Family Releases Burial Dates For Nollywood Actor, Saint Obi
item.description: August, 18th has been fixed for the burial of the late Nollywood actor, Saint Obi, by his family. Naija News reported that the thespian died on Sunday, May 7, 2023, in the home of one of his siblings at 13 Metropolitan Street in Tudun Wada, Jos. The family of late Nollywood actor, Saint Obi disclosed details of his burial ceremony on Thursday, August 3rd. The statement reads partly, ”The Nwafor family of Ogwa, Imo State cordially invites you as, Our Superhero goes home Obinna Nwafor Saint Obi, Our beloved husband, father, brother, uncle and son.

item.title: Former Senate President Joins Presidential Race
item.description: A former Senate President, Anyim Pius Anyim has declared his intention to contest the 2023 presidential election. Anyim made his intentions known on Saturday while speaking with newsmen, adding that he will be seeking the presidential ticket of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). According to the former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, zoning will not affect his resolve to seek the PDP presidential ticket. He argued that the zoning the PDP did only has to do with the elective offices at the party’s national convention and not for the 2023 general polls.

item.title: How to become a pharmacist in Kenya: Requirements and institutions
item.description: Students who excel in their K.C.S.E pick pharmacy as a career path because of its potential rewards after medical school. Additionally, this course exposes them to a whole new world of science emphasising medical drug administration. However, there are minimum requirements that you must meet for you to become a pharmacist in Kenya. Pharmacy plays a significant role in the country's health sector. Pharmacists are responsible for prescribing and dispensing medication, disease prevention and management, and patient counselling in hospitals, institutions, or community outlets.

item.title: Is Tamar Braxton Still in the Hospital? She Broke Her Instagram Silence
item.description: Tamar Braxton Pens Heartfelt Post Thanking God for Saving Her LifeBy Distractify StaffUpdated Dec. 16 2020, 11:56 a.m. ET Source: gettyFor the first time since late July, Tamar Braxton has broken her social media silence, taking to Instagram on Monday, Sept. 21 to thank God for saving her life. Back on July 16, the singer and reality star was rushed to the hospital after a suicide attempt at the Ritz-Carlton Residences in downtown L.

item.title: Jasmine Brown - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Model and YouTube star otherwise known as JasMeannnn who gained popularity posting vlogs, tags, and beauty tutorials to more than 2.3 million subscribers. She was also a winner of the 2015 Wet Seal Model Search and one of 10 winners of the Tyrabeauty model search 2017 campaign. She signed with LA Models in 2016. Before Fame During high school, she reached nationals in gymnastics as one of only 13 girls to represent Texas.

item.title: Ken Okoth: Raila Odinga, Kalonzo Musyoka lead politicians in mourning Kibra MP
item.description: Leaders drawn from the political and corporate spheres have described demise of Kibra MP Ken Okoth as a big blow not only to Kenyans but Africa as a whole. Led by Opposition politicians Raila Odinga and Kalonzo Musyoka, the leaders expressed their shock at the untimely death of the man many described as a brave champion of equal education. item.title: Mariana Isabel Downing - Age, Family, Bio
Nigerian Newspapers Daily Front Pages Review
item.description: Naija News looks at the top happenings making headlines on the front pages of Nigeria’s national newspapers today Thursday, March, 10th 2022. The PUNCH reports that the Governor Nasir El-Rufai of Kaduna State on Wednesday said the governors of the All Progressives Congress discovered a grand conspiracy between the lawyers of the ousted   Chairman of the APC Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee, Mai Mala Buni; and some fifth columnists to postpone the national convention of the party through a court injunction.

item.title: Ogunbiyi Votes As Davido Raises Alarm Over Alleged Irregularities
item.description: The governorship candidate for Accord Party in the Osun State gubernatorial election, Akin Ogunbiyi has cast his vote. Naija News understands that Ogunbiyi was at his polling unit; PU03, Ward 05 located at Methodist Primary School, Ileogbo, Ayedire Local Government Area of the State this morning. The governorship hopeful exercised his civic rights as he hope to defeat his counterpart from the ruling All Progressives Congress, Governor Adegboyega Otetola and candidates from other opposition parties.

item.title: Paid Partnership Videos on TikTok Turn Normal TikTok Videos Into Paid Ads
item.description: The Paid Partnership label on TikTok has only become more popular recently, but some users are confused about what the label actually means. Source: Getty ImagesAs is the case on all social platforms, the ultimate goal of influencers is to find ways to get paid for what they do. TikTok has been the subject of some controversy around its pay practices, but it's also worked to introduce new ways for users to monetize their content.

item.title: Premier League Matchweek Three Fixtures, Kick-off Time
item.description: The 2023-2024 Premier League matchweek three will kick off on Friday, August 25, when newly promoted Luton Town visit Stamford Bridge to face Chelsea at 8 p.m. Coach Mauricio Pochettino and his Blues boys are yet to win any match so far this season and have recorded one draw against Liverpool, and a defeat against West Ham United, already this season. Hence, the game against Luton is a must-win for Chelsea as they attempt to contend for the Premier League title this season.

item.title: What Happened to Billy Sparks' Sister on 'Young Sheldon'?
item.description: What Happened to Billy Sparks' Sister on 'Young Sheldon'?"Since she isn't really that integral to the story, they just don't show her." By Melissa WilletsMay 17 2024, Published 12:09 p.m. ET Source: CBSBilly Sparks may have been a recurring character on Young Sheldon for all seven seasons of the popular CBS series, but his little sister Bobbi hasn't been seen since 2019. Now, with the show wrapping up its final season, fans want to know — whatever happened to Bobbi?

item.title: What Happened to the Deep Tracks Channel on SiriusXM?
item.description: Fans are confused after the Deep Tracks channel on SiriusXM seemed to disappear, and many want to better understand where the channel went. The Gist: SiriusXM appears to have quietly retired Deep Tracks, one of its stations, and many users are upset about the change. Deep Tracks played classic rock songs that were never released as singles and were only available on albums.The retirement of the channel could be part of broader cost-cutting efforts as SiriusXM deals with the emergence of streaming music.

item.title: Where Is Raheel Ahmed Now? Case Explained
item.description: Sania Khan Went Viral for Posting About Her Divorce on TikTok — Then She Was KilledSania Khan and Raheel Ahmed had the perfect wedding but their marriage was a different story. By Jennifer TisdalePublished June 10 2024, 1:41 p.m. ET Source: TikTok/@geminigirl_099Sania Khan The TikTok account of Sania Khan tells two different stories. One is that of a Pakistani woman struggling with other members of her South Asian community, and the other is someone ready to start a new life after a bad marriage.
